intro: Borneacanthus, commonly known as the Bornean spurge, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant typically features succulent leaves and produces small, clustered flowers with a distinctive yellowish-green color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
